topic.title: Copying Additional Resources to Output Directory

body.p: You can copy additional resources (such as JavaScript, CSS or other resources) to the WebHelp output directory either by creating a new or by using the webhelp.custom.resources parameter.

section.title: Using the WebHelp Publishing Template method
section.p: It is recommended to use a because it allows you to easier share with your team or upgrade the .

sectiondiv.p:
To copy additional resources to the output directory using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Create a new WebHelp Publishing Template or skip this step you have already one.
Place all your resources in the directory associated with the publishing template. You can create a new one, custom-resources for instance.
Open the template descriptor associated with your publishing template.
Add a new fileset element in resources section of the template descriptor. <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <resources> <fileset> <include name="custom-resources/**/*"/> <exclude name="**/.git"/> </fileset>
Edit the WebHelp transformation scenario.
Use the Choose Custom Publishing Template and select your newly created template.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.
Run the transformation scenario.
Result: All files from the new directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output directory in the /oxygen-webhelp/template folder.

p.b: Publishing Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

sectiondiv.p:
To copy additional resources to the output directory using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Create a new WebHelp Publishing Template or skip this step you have already one.
Place all your resources in the directory associated with the publishing template. You can create a new one, custom-resources for instance.
Open the template descriptor associated with your publishing template.
Add a new fileset element in resources section of the template descriptor. <publishing-template> ... <webhelp> ... <resources> <fileset> <include name="custom-resources/**/*"/> <exclude name="**/.git"/> </fileset>
Specify the absolute path to the publishing template directory using the parameter.
Execute the transformation script.
Result: All files from the new directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output directory in the /oxygen-webhelp/template folder.

For example:
Windows:
dita.bat -i mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.custom.resources=custom-template
Mac OS X/ Linux:
dita -i mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.custom.resources=custom-template

section.title: Using the webhelp.custom.resources parameter
section.p: If you consider to complicated to create a or you have a simple customization you can achieve the same result using the webhelp.custom.resources.

sectiondiv.p:
To copy additional resources to the output directory using a transformation scenario from within Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Place all your resources in the same directory.
Edit the WebHelp transformation scenario, then open the Parameters tab.
Edit the value for the webhelp.custom.resources parameter and set it to the absolute path of the directory in step 1.
Click OK to save the changes to the transformation scenario.
Run the transformation scenario.
Result: All files from the new directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output directory.

p.b: Publishing Using a Script Outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author

note.product: author developer editor authorEclipse developerEclipse editorEclipse

sectiondiv.p:
To copy additional resources to the output directory using a script outside of Oxygen XML Editor/Author, follow this procedure:
Place all your resources in the same directory.
Specify the absolute path to that directory using the webhelp.custom.resources parameter.
Execute the transformation script.
Result: All files from the new directory will be copied to the root of the WebHelp output directory.

For example:
Windows:
dita.bat -i c:\mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.custom.resources=c:\resources
Mac OS X/ Linux:
dita -i C:/mySample.ditamap -f webhelp-responsive -Dwebhelp.custom.resources=C:/resources
